channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: FBI reopening investigation into cocaine found at Biden White House
item.description: The FBI is reexamining the small bag of cocaine found inside the White House in 2023 during the Biden administration, Deputy Director Dan Bongino said...

item.title: Rahm Emanuel calls Democrats' party brand 'weak,' appearing to weigh White House run
item.description: Former Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel is among a large group of Democrats expected to announce White House bids before the 2028 race kicks off.

item.title: More U.S. consumers than last year say they prefer gas-powered vehicles over electric or hybrid
item.description: Tariffs are having a significant effect on consumers’ auto purchase decisions.

item.title: Menopause startup Midi Health launches a longevity platform for women who want to be ‘healthy grandmothers’
item.description: Longevity isn't just for men trying to live to 150.

item.title: Corporate America’s Welcome Retreat from Wokeness

item.title: It hasn’t been this hard to find a used car since the height of COVID
item.description: Tariffs drive people away from new cars, creating a shortage on used car lots.

item.title: Emil Bove Is A Bold And Outstanding Choice For The Third Circuit
item.description: Emil Bove is a potential nominee for a New Jersey-based seat on the Third Circuit Court of Appeals. Bove has outstanding credentials.

item.title: GOP Georgia Senate candidate targets vulnerable Jon Ossoff in ad depicting transgender 'fan'

item.title: GOP-Appointed University Of Florida Trustees Vote On DEI Booster For President Today
item.description: The University of Florida may reverse its nation-leading shift away from identity politics by hiring a DEI-pushing president.

item.title: Gavin Newsom Supports Medicaid Changes — Why Don’t Republicans?
item.description: To cut federal spending, Republicans should join Gov. Gavin Newsom, D-Calif., in reforming Medicaid and saving federal dollars.
